com.navis.framework.persistence.scope

Interface EntityScoper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseEntityScoper, GlobalEntityScoper, N4EntityScoper

    public interface EntityScoper
    Purpose: An interface that provides the Scope of the supplied Domain Entity for the supplied UserContext.

    Bean Usage: EntityScoper entityScoper = (EntityScoper) Roastery.getBean(EntityScoper.BEAN_ID);

    Author:
    Jon Shields Date: Mar 12, 2004

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BEAN_ID
      Spring Bean Name for the implementation of this interface

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearScopeCache()
      Clears the cache to allow for changes in the DB to be reloaded.
      DomainQuery createScopeNodeEntityLevelQuery(com.navis.framework.configuration.IScopeEnum inScopeLevel, ScopeCoordinates inScopeCoordinates)
      Query to create the different values of a a given non GLOBAL inScopeLevel (full scope path) for a supported flexibly scoped object.
      DomainQuery enhanceDomainQuery(DomainQuery inDomainQuery, UserContext inUserContext)

      Find scope coordinates
      com.navis.framework.configuration.IScopeEnum getMostSpecificSupportedScopeEnum()
      Gets the IScopeEnum that is supported for flexibly scopable entities.
      PredicateIntf getPredicateForBroadestAllowedScope(ScopeCoordinates inCoordinates, MetafieldId inScopeLevelFieldId, MetafieldId inScopeGkeyFieldId)
      For Scoped coordinates (non GLOBAL), this will return the query for the broadest scope subtree of supported flexibly scoped entities.

      Generic method to return the scope coordinates i.e.
      ScopeCoordinates getScopeCoordinates(java.lang.String[] inScopeHierarchy)
      Generic method to return the scope coordinates given a hierarchical array of strings of named scopes, where the 0th index string is the name of the broadest scope.

      Get the IScopeEnum given scope level as an integer, where 1=Global, 2=First application level, etc.

      Get user-friendly representation of scope level.

      Given scope coordinates, return the entity (if any) that corresponds to that node in the scope hierarchy.

      Gets the list of all supported IScopeEnum (entities can be flexibly scoped at these levels).

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityScope

        Scope getEntityScope(java.lang.String inEntityClassName,
                     UserContext inUserContext)
        Returns the Scope object given the entity and user context
        Parameters:
        inEntityClassName - class name, must be a scoped entity, such as reference entity

      • enhanceDomainQuery

        DomainQuery enhanceDomainQuery(DomainQuery inDomainQuery,
                               UserContext inUserContext)
        Query interceptor: allows back-end modification of all queries.

      • createScopeNodeEntityLevelQuery

        DomainQuery createScopeNodeEntityLevelQuery(com.navis.framework.configuration.IScopeEnum inScopeLevel,
                                            ScopeCoordinates inScopeCoordinates)
        Query to create the different values of a a given non GLOBAL inScopeLevel (full scope path) for a supported flexibly scoped object. If parent key not available, it will generate all scope paths at the inScopeLevel. Whether to disable further scoping is left to caller.

      • getScopeCoordinates

        @NotNull
ScopeCoordinates getScopeCoordinates(com.navis.framework.configuration.IScopeEnum inScopeLevel,
                                               java.io.Serializable inNode)
        Generic method to return the scope coordinates i.e. full path to a given node.

        Given inScopeLevel is state and inNode is "CA", will return scope coordinates ["US", "CA"] Note that since gkeys can be either longs or strings, the entity scoper implementation must deal with the typing

      • getScopeCoordinates

        ScopeCoordinates getScopeCoordinates(java.lang.String[] inScopeHierarchy)
        Generic method to return the scope coordinates given a hierarchical array of strings of named scopes, where the 0th index string is the name of the broadest scope. The last indexed string is the name/id of the most specific scope.
        Parameters:
        inScopeHierarchy -
        Returns:
        - ScopeCoordinates

      • getScopeEnum

        com.navis.framework.configuration.IScopeEnum getScopeEnum(int inLevel)
        Get the IScopeEnum given scope level as an integer, where 1=Global, 2=First application level, etc.

        Returns:

      • getPredicateForBroadestAllowedScope

        @Nullable
PredicateIntf getPredicateForBroadestAllowedScope(ScopeCoordinates inCoordinates,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             MetafieldId inScopeLevelFieldId,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             MetafieldId inScopeGkeyFieldId)
        For Scoped coordinates (non GLOBAL), this will return the query for the broadest scope subtree of supported flexibly scoped entities.
        Parameters:
        broadestAllowedScope -
        inScopeLevelFieldId -
        inScopeGkeyFieldId -
        Returns:
        the predicate for a flexibly scoped object (generic scope based on scope level and scope gkey) based on broadestAllowedScope.
